title: Apple is latest Big Tech player to plan cost cuts: report
text:
News of the targeted cost-cutting edict comes a week before the company is scheduled to announce quarterly results. Despite the trimming, Apple still intends a full product launch schedule in 2023 that includes a mixed-reality headset, according to Bloomberg.

Apple was not immediately available for comment.

An imperfect storm of inflation, the war in Ukraine, supply-chain slowdowns, and a possible recession has sent some of tech's biggest players scrambling to slash expenses as they prepare to announce quarterly results.

In recent days, the chief executives of Facebook parent company Meta Platforms Inc. META and Alphabet Inc.'s GOOGL GOOG Google have informed staff of impending cost reductions and slowing hiring.

Meanwhile, Microsoft Corp. MSFT has imposed a hiring freeze, Netflix Inc. NFLX has announced two layoff rounds of about 450 people, and Amazon.com Inc. AMZN discussed belt tightening during its first-quarter earnings announcement in April.

Netflix is scheduled to report earnings Tuesday, and the rest are slated for next week.

At the same time, Twitter Inc. TWTR, Coinbase Global Inc. COIN, Tesla Inc. TSLA, Redfin Corp. RDFN, and Peloton Interactive Inc. PTON have also reported layoffs.
